body:
Comment 5 by **ciserlohn**: 
Presumably the official binary distribution is build only once. The MacPorts version
will likely be build many times because MacPorts packages (ports) are source based. If
the port refers to the branch any commit on the branch will break the build because of a
checksum mismatch. So if you could tag the revision which was used for the officical
binary distribution it would be much easier to bundle godoc and vet with the port. Or
tag the current head, the most import thing for me is a reference to a specific revision.
